title: MyFeedbacks
description: A feedback management service developed to help users and companies improve some of the best products in the world.
article:
MyFeedbacks is a platform that allows you to share feedbacks, ideas and bug reports on any app or online service that you may think of. This project was built with my good friend @romainbourre, and we are still improving it on our free time.

I have been developing the entire visual interface, and I am in charge of the front-end development, done in Angular. I am working on the MyFeedbacks visual framework, to make sure all the components are harmonized across the whole platform.

I developed an adaptative dark theme based on preferences, to improve accessibility.

The color scheme must help to quickly understand the status of a post.

Our stack

  • Angular
  • .NET
  • SQLite
  • MySQL
  • Github

title: Stoodent
description: Our dream to build the best school management system, to provide the best experience to students, teachers and staff.
article:
When we were studying at our school, I was not satisfied with the tools used to manage our calendar, our classes, our homeworks... Almost everything was either ugly, not fonctionnal, and most of the time both. @romainbourre and @jbrigal agreed with me, so we decided to build something that would regroup all those ugly and unusable apps into a single, simple and clean interface that could be used by students, teachers and school staff.

I learned Angular with this project, as I was in charge of the front-end development. I also developed some of the back-end features, using Symfony.

Our stack

  • Angular
  • Symfony
  • SQLite
  • MySQL

title: Digitab
description: Go to a restaurant with your friends, and make sure everyone pays their share. With a bill scanner.
article:
We were going to the restaurant pretty frequently with my friends, and we always had this lame moment when everyone has to look for what they ordered in order to know who needs to pay what. So I decided I could build an app that would do exactly that: list what everyone ordered, and make sure that everyone know how much he should pay.

I built the entire system using Angular and Symfony, but since I wanted to get the orders very easily, I also used an OCR system to automaticaly scan bills. I also built a real time service, so everyone could connect on the same table, see who is connected and make sure that the orders are splitted correctly.

This project had two main issues:

  • First, even if the bill scanner was working (which was not always the case), everyone had to pick their order. So the core problem I built the app for was not fixed.
  • You could not pay directly in the app, even if it was the ambition.

And a few months later, SundayApp came to life, so it made this project basically useless. I still enjoyed a lot doing it a I learned a lot from it.

Our stack

  • Angular
  • Symfony
  • MySQL

title: Covid-19 - Centres de test
description: As the Covid-19 pandemic started, we decided to build a platform to regroup all the testing centers when it did not exist.
article:
During the Covid-19 pandemics, we were all in quarantine. And obviously, as soon as we identified a problem, we decided to try and help.

At the time, there was very little information about Covid-19 test centers. So, with @romainbourre, we implemented a very simple website that was supposed to let people report the test center near them. And on a daily basis, we would produce a CSV file that would be sent to the Google Maps and Apple Maps teams, so they could integrate it in their apps and make sure that people could easily look for their nearest test centers.

This website was done, but never really used. However, it was pretty fun to build it in a kind of speedrun fashion.

Our stack

  • Angular
  • Symfony
  • MySQL
